blocks.name: getProfile
blocks.description: Gets the current user's Gmail profile.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

blocks.name: stopMailboxNotifications

args.name: email

blocks.name: setMailboxNotification
blocks.description: Set up or update a push notification watch on the given user mailbox.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: topicName
args.info: A fully qualified Google Cloud Pub/Sub API topic name to publish the events to. This topic name **must** already exist in Cloud Pub/Sub and you **must** have already granted gmail "publish" permission on it. For example, "projects/my-project-identifier/topics/my-topic-name" (using the Cloud Pub/Sub "v1" topic naming format).

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

args.name: labelFilterAction
args.info: Filtering behavior of labelIds list specified.

args.name: labelIds
args.info: List of label_ids to restrict notifications about. By default, if unspecified, all changes are pushed out. If specified then dictates which labels are required for a push notification to be generated.

args.info: Token received from Gmail

blocks.name: getMailboxMessages
blocks.description: Lists the messages in the user's mailbox

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: labelIds
args.info: Only return messages with labels that match all of the specified label IDs.

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

args.name: includeSpamTrash
args.info: Include messages from SPAM and TRASH in the results

args.name: maxResults
args.info: Maximum number of messages to return.

args.name: pageToken
args.info: Page token to retrieve a specific page of results in the list.

args.name: q
args.info: Only return messages matching the specified query. Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box. For example, "from:someuser@example.com rfc822msgid: is:unread".

blocks.name: insertMessageIntoMailbox
blocks.description: Directly inserts a message into only this user's mailbox similar to IMAP APPEND, bypassing most scanning and classification. Does not send a message.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: raw
args.info: The entire email message in an RFC 2822 formatted and base64url encoded string. Returned in messages.get and drafts.get responses when the format=RAW parameter is supplied.

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

args.name: internalDateSource
args.info: Source for Gmail's internal date of the message.

args.name: deleted
args.info: Mark the email as permanently deleted (not TRASH) and only visible in Google Vault to a Vault administrator. Only used for G Suite accounts.

args.name: labelIds
args.info: Only return messages with labels that match all of the specified label IDs.

args.info: The format to return the message in.

blocks.name: importMessageIntoMailbox
blocks.description: Imports a message into only this user's mailbox, with standard email delivery scanning and classification similar to receiving via SMTP. Does not send a message.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: raw
args.info: The entire email message in an RFC 2822 formatted and base64url encoded string. Returned in messages.get and drafts.get responses when the format=RAW parameter is supplied.

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

args.name: deleted
args.info: Mark the email as permanently deleted (not TRASH) and only visible in Google Vault to a Vault administrator. Only used for G Suite accounts.

args.name: neverMarkSpam
args.info: Ignore the Gmail spam classifier decision and never mark this email as SPAM in the mailbox.

args.name: processForCalendar
args.info: Process calendar invites in the email and add any extracted meetings to the Google Calendar for this user.

args.name: internalDateSource

blocks.name: updateAutoForwarding
blocks.description: Updates the auto-forwarding setting for the specified account. A verified forwarding address must be specified when auto-forwarding is enabled.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

args.name: enabled
args.info: Whether all incoming mail is automatically forwarded to another address.

args.name: emailAddress
args.info: Email address to which all incoming messages are forwarded. This email address must be a verified member of the forwarding addresses.

args.name: disposition
args.info: The state that a message should be left in after it has been forwarded.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

args.name: enabled
args.info: Whether IMAP is enabled for the account.

args.name: maxFolderSize
args.info: An optional limit on the number of messages that an IMAP folder may contain. Legal values are 0, 1000, 2000, 5000 or 10000. A value of zero is interpreted to mean that there is no limit.

args.name: expungeBehavior
args.info: The action that will be executed on a message when it is marked as deleted and expunged from the last visible IMAP folder.

args.name: autoExpunge
args.info: If this value is true, Gmail will immediately expunge a message when it is marked as deleted in IMAP. Otherwise, Gmail will wait for an update from the client before expunging messages marked as deleted.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

args.name: emailAddress
args.info: Email address to which all incoming messages are forwarded. This email address must be a verified member of the forwarding addresses.

args.name: disposition
args.info: The action that will be executed on a message after it has been fetched via POP.

args.name: accessWindow
args.info: The range of messages which are accessible via POP.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

args.name: enableAutoReply
args.info: Flag that controls whether Gmail automatically replies to messages.

args.name: responseSubject
args.info: Optional text to prepend to the subject line in vacation responses. In order to enable auto-replies, either the response subject or the response body must be nonempty.

args.name: responseBodyPlainText
args.info: Response body in plain text format.

args.name: responseBodyHtml
args.info: Response body in HTML format. Gmail will sanitize the HTML before storing it.

args.name: restrictToContacts
args.info: Flag that determines whether responses are sent to recipients who are not in the user's list of contacts.

args.name: restrictToDomain
args.info: Flag that determines whether responses are sent to recipients who are outside of the user's domain. This feature is only available for G Suite users.

args.name: startTime
args.info: An optional start time for sending auto-replies (Y-m-d H:m:s). When this is specified, Gmail will automatically reply only to messages that it receives after the start time. If both startTime and endTime are specified, startTime must precede endTime.

args.name: endTime
args.info: An optional end time for sending auto-replies (Y-m-d H:m:s). When this is specified, Gmail will automatically reply only to messages that it receives before the end time. If both startTime and endTime are specified, startTime must precede endTime.

blocks.name: getForwardingAddresses
blocks.description: Lists the forwarding addresses for the specified account.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

args.name: forwardingEmail
args.info: The forwarding address to be deleted.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

args.name: addLabelIds
args.info: Labels to add

args.name: removeLabelIds
args.info: Labels to remove

args.name: forward
args.info: Email address that the message should be forwarded to.

args.name: excludeChats
args.info: Whether the response should exclude chats.

args.name: from
args.info: The sender's display name or email address.

args.name: hasAttachment
args.info: Whether the message has any attachment.

args.name: negatedQuery
args.info: Only return messages not matching the specified query. Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box. For example, "from:someuser@example.com rfc822msgid: is:unread".

args.name: query
args.info: Only return messages matching the specified query. Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box. For example, "from:someuser@example.com rfc822msgid: is:unread".

args.name: size
args.info: The size of the entire RFC822 message in bytes, including all headers and attachments.

args.name: sizeComparison
args.info: How the message size in bytes should be in relation to the size field.

args.name: subject
args.info: Case-insensitive phrase found in the message's subject. Trailing and leading whitespace are be trimmed and adjacent spaces are collapsed.

args.name: to
args.info: The recipient's display name or email address. Includes recipients in the "to", "cc", and "bcc" header fields. You can use simply the local part of the email address. For example, "example" and "example@" both match "example@gmail.com". This field is case-insensitive.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: filterId
args.info: Id of the filter

args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: filterId

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

args.name: sendAsEmail
args.info: An optional email address that is included in a "Reply-To:" header for mail sent using this alias. If this is empty, Gmail will not generate a "Reply-To:" header.

args.name: displayName
args.info: A name that appears in the "From:" header for mail sent using this alias. For custom "from" addresses, when this is empty, Gmail will populate the "From:" header with the name that is used for the primary address associated with the account.

args.name: isDefault
args.info: Whether this address is selected as the default

args.name: replyToAddress
args.info: An optional email address that is included in a "Reply-To:" header for mail sent using this alias. If this is empty, Gmail will not generate a "Reply-To:" header.

args.name: signature
args.info: An optional HTML signature that is included in messages composed with this alias in the Gmail web UI.

args.name: host
args.info: The hostname of the SMTP service.

args.name: password
args.info: The password that will be used for authentication with the SMTP service.

args.name: port
args.info: The port of the SMTP service.

args.name: securityMode
args.info: The protocol that will be used to secure communication with the SMTP service.

args.name: username
args.info: The username that will be used for authentication with the SMTP service.

args.name: treatAsAlias
args.info: Whether Gmail should treat this address as an alias for the user's primary email address. This setting only applies to custom "from" aliases.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

args.name: sendAsEmail
args.info: An optional email address that is included in a "Reply-To:" header for mail sent using this alias. If this is empty, Gmail will not generate a "Reply-To:" header.

args.name: displayName
args.info: A name that appears in the "From:" header for mail sent using this alias. For custom "from" addresses, when this is empty, Gmail will populate the "From:" header with the name that is used for the primary address associated with the account.

args.name: isDefault
args.info: Whether this address is selected as the default

args.name: replyToAddress
args.info: An optional email address that is included in a "Reply-To:" header for mail sent using this alias. If this is empty, Gmail will not generate a "Reply-To:" header.

args.name: signature
args.info: An optional HTML signature that is included in messages composed with this alias in the Gmail web UI.

args.name: host
args.info: The hostname of the SMTP service.

args.name: password
args.info: The password that will be used for authentication with the SMTP service.

args.name: port
args.info: The port of the SMTP service.

args.name: securityMode
args.info: The protocol that will be used to secure communication with the SMTP service.

args.name: username
args.info: The username that will be used for authentication with the SMTP service.

args.name: treatAsAlias
args.info: Whether Gmail should treat this address as an alias for the user's primary email address. This setting only applies to custom "from" aliases.

blocks.name: getSendAsAliasSMIMEconfig
blocks.description: Get single S/MIME config for the specified send-as alias

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: sendAsEmail
args.info: The send-as alias to be retrieved.

args.name: configId
args.info: The immutable ID for the SmimeInfo.

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

blocks.name: insertSendAsAliasSMIMEconfig
blocks.description: Insert (upload) the given S/MIME config for the specified send-as alias. Note that pkcs12 format is required for the key.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: sendAsEmail
args.info: The send-as alias to be retrieved.

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

args.name: expiration
args.info: When the certificate expires (Y-m-d H:m:s).

args.name: issuerCn
args.info: The S/MIME certificate issuer's common name.

args.name: isDefault
args.info: Whether this SmimeInfo is the default one for this user's send-as address.

args.name: pem
args.info: PEM formatted X509 concatenated certificate string (standard base64 encoding). Format used for returning key, which includes public key as well as certificate chain (not private key).

args.name: pkcs12
args.info: PKCS#12 format containing a single private/public key pair and certificate chain. This format is only accepted from client for creating a new SmimeInfo and is never returned, because the private key is not intended to be exported. PKCS#12 may be encrypted, in which case encryptedKeyPassword should be set appropriately.

args.name: encryptedKeyPassword
args.info: Encrypted key password, when key is encrypted.

blocks.name: setSMIMEconfigAsDefault
blocks.description: Sets the default S/MIME config for the specified send-as alias.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: sendAsEmail
args.info: The send-as alias to be retrieved.

args.name: configId
args.info: The immutable ID for the SmimeInfo.

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

blocks.name: deleteSendAsAliasSMIMEconfig

args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

blocks.name: getMailboxHistory
blocks.description: Lists the history of all changes to the given mailbox. History results are returned in chronological order (increasing historyId)

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Token received from Gmail

args.name: startHistoryId
args.info: Returns history records after the specified startHistoryId.

args.name: historyTypes

structure.name: historyType
structure.info: History types to be returned by the function Acceptable values are: labelAdded, labelRemoved, messageAdded, messageDeleted

args.info: The immutable ID for the SmimeInfo.

args.name: labelId
args.info: Only return messages with a label matching the ID.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: The maximum number of history records to return.

args.name: pageToken
args.info: Page token to retrieve a specific page of results in the list.

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.
